TopicTitle: Various Chinese space news (LM-9, Tianzhou, ion engines, more)

Articles.Content:
Lot's of news has come through so lets go:

LM-9-They have successfully built and tested many 8.7m aluminium alloy rings, like the one from September, for the now confirmed Long March 9. Development of the moon rocket progress's quick and fluently.

Joint Lab-The Chinese and Germans have combined efforts into a joint technology laboratory to develop advanced technology like electric propulsion.

Robotics company-A new advanced robotics company has been founded to work on better probes, etc.

Ion engine-An ion engine has been developed for satellites to remain in space for longer and to progress further development. This was launched in 2012.

Tianzhou-Further work on the Tianzhou cargo vehicle continues and more tests have been completed.

The final launch of 2014 was conducted earlier this morning, a FY2-G satellite was placed into GTO, this leaves China with a total launches count of 16 for 2014, not too great but 2015 will have many more .
